Posted By: auriscope (6/16/2012 8:20:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Has anyone else seen this card show up in some of the newer Reanimator decks in Legacy? Seriously, I wonder why this is becoming a target now.   
  
I think for one thing you could hard cast it. It also negates that reanimate you played. Lifelink is pretty good, but it's ability is not typically what a Reanimator deck wants to do (all Jin-Gitaxas aside).  
  
This guy is blackest thing out there in Standard right now, so I respect it, as he is super bad and epitomizes what I would consider **Suicide-Black**.
posts.html:
Has anyone else seen this card show up in some of the newer Reanimator decks in Legacy? Seriously, I wonder why this is becoming a target now.

I think for one thing you could hard cast it. It also negates that reanimate you played. Lifelink is pretty good, but it's ability is not typically what a Reanimator deck wants to do (all Jin-Gitaxas aside).

This guy is blackest thing out there in Standard right now, so I respect it, as he is super bad and epitomizes what I would consider Suicide-Black.

posts.post_content:
Even though I play Drana EDH, I knew to not invest in this. This card was already too good to be true. We all know why Yawgmoth's Bargain is banned over Necropotence, and it certainly follows true here, as well as gives us an unnecessary (but cool) 7/7 flying lifelink trample demon guy.   
  
Yawgmoth's Bargain doesn't gain you life, kill creatures or deal damage (with evasion, mind you). And you expect that we should get this for EIGHT MANA? If this was printed on a 13 mana Eldrazi, it would still be iffy, and maybe banworthy. At 8, you have so much silliness that'll get you up the like Cabal Coffers, Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth, Extraplanar Lens, Gauntlet of Power, Caged Sun, Heartless Summoning and so forth (the intricate stuff like Dark Ritual or Ashnod's Altar don't really always count), you'll be getting this guy out turn 3-6. Or you could Entomb/Exhume it on turn one with a Dark Ritual, however Reanimator tactics generally start turn 2-3 in EDH, so you can feasibly get him out on turn ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Guy lasted longer in the story than he did in EDH.  
  
Not a very surprising ban though. I knew it was probably coming but I made him my captain since all my friends made decks around the legendary angels from the set. Yeah, once I upped my land count to 40 I never lost a game. The reliability of ramping into this on turn six or so, drawing thirty-five to fifty cards, dropping a [reliquary tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reliquary tower), [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) (Or equivilent) and [Empyrial Plate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empyrial Plate) and winning instantly was staggering. In the rare event that someone could respond to any of this, you can *still* get the card draw!! It doesn't matter if he is on the bottom of my library.  
  
A couple times I had to wait and win with a massive, ramped up [Exsanguinate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exsanguinate), but that wasn't exactly unreliable. The worst part was that he wasn't *fun*. He would hit the field, and I would spend five minutes drawing cards, then I would play a couple things while m... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
The irony of Griselbrand is I actually don't see you drawing very many 'real' cards with him actually.  
  
He's a 7/7 lifelinker with evasion.   
  
You combo him out, and start attacking people to kill them. His pay life ability offers him protection because people DON'T want you to do that in response to a kill spell to 'replace' him.  
  
Alright, so in Commander, he's just tiny and it's a very different story: They WILL want to kill him, you WILL...get a load of other cards anyway...and they WILL....die anyway. But he's banned there now so that doesn't count, exactly.  
  
My speculation, admitting no experience on it, is that in Legacy/Vintage, where you have less life to pay AND less life you need to take to win, is that he probably races/kills pretty fast and even tho you draw the cards anyway 'because they're free and you can', you probably don't actually get a chance to use them much. Your deck can do other things sure, if it's comboing it wants at least two different things to combo out, bu... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I feel sorry for him. I mean...he will never be able to use spoon and fork! Not even chopsticks!  
Well I don't know how you eat souls to be honest...maybe straw is enough?  
  
Jokes aside, he was banned ind EDH for the reason. Still the teror of the kitchen table but not EDH anymore...sad. I will for forever remember his tag team with Niv Mizzet in my Sedris, the Traitor King deck.  
  
Gris is at the same time more and less balanced then Necropotence. Card draw is faster and you get the NOW compared to potance. At the same time trought he can be dealt with easier for being creature, costs more and you HAVE to pay 7 life...a bit less controlable the Necropotance - there is a bigger risk that you get big burn to tha face. Unlike Potence however he can replenish your life pool and kill opponent at the same time. Necropotance unlike Gris can be pulled on first turn with the help of Dark Ritual and be ready for you we you need cards. It's also and enchantment - pernament type which was hardest to ... posts.post_content:
This guy is beyond good. Run with [Mutilate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mutilate), [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk), [Gilded Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilded Lotus), and some tutors.  
  
If he ever gets going you will be unstoppable. Even if they destroy him you can still pay 7 and get 7, and that alone can win you the game.

posts.post_content:
The irony of Griselbrand is I actually don't see you drawing very many 'real' cards with him actually.  
  
He's a 7/7 lifelinker with evasion.   
  
You combo him out, and start attacking people to kill them. His pay life ability offers him protection because people DON'T want you to do that in response to a kill spell to 'replace' him.  
  
Alright, so in Commander, he's just tiny and it's a very different story: They WILL want to kill him, you WILL...get a load of other cards anyway...and they WILL....die anyway. But he's banned there now so that doesn't count, exactly.  
  
My speculation, admitting no experience on it, is that in Legacy/Vintage, where you have less life to pay AND less life you need to take to win, is that he probably races/kills pretty fast and even tho you draw the cards anyway 'because they're free and you can', you probably don't actually get a chance to use them much.
